<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.

Regarding your second question, you can add additional parameters to a for loop by using the "and" operator "&&" in the condition. However, in your case, it seems that you want to add a condition inside the loop, which is not possible with the for loop. Instead, you can use a while loop and add the condition inside the loop.
